title: GIFs and live streams causing mini lockups. Firefox fullscreening itself.
content:
Hello,

Around a week ago (ish), I tried to play a GIF on Firefox. The GIF wouldn't load, Firefox became very unresponsive and it would occasionally fullscreen itself (Removing the taskbar) for a brief moment before changing back. It would keep this up until I force closed it. I went to load a Twitch stream after loading Firefox again, and the chat would work just fine, but the video wouldn't load. The micro freezes (Loading symbol next to mouse pointer) and the fullscreening would happen again. I tried a computer restart and things were fine for a few days.

Today, the same issue happened with Twitch streams, even though I watched one yesterday with no issues. I tried a restart, but the issue persists. Everything seems to work fine on Chrome.

Also, games seem to work just fine. I thought the load time on one may have felt a little slow, but that could just be the game, but I felt it was worth mentioning.

So far, I've tried: - Using Chrome (Everything works fine there) - Using Firefox in troubleshooting mode - Disabling hardware acceleration - Refreshing the startup cache - Updating my GPU drivers - Ensuring Firefox is up to date

Any ideas? Thank you for any help.
creator: minkysteve

title: Can't access account with firefox addons I created
content:
I have an account where I have addons that I published and support. I have 2 factor authentication. But I moved to a new iphone (the whole data was copied to a new mobile) BUT google authenticator doesn't copy all keys. So now I can't access Firefox account. I had firefox log in on another device, I have even a page opened with all my addons on the screen, but if I try to open settings - it requires me to insert the code. I don't have it. and FAQ says that's all, create a new account. The best solution would be: - user lost keys? - freeze the account for 1/2/3 months. If there is no activity, reset the 2nd authentication.

Why not? Why do we need to create new account? How can I move all my addons to the new one?

creator: suzannet2014

title: Youtube Stream Hardware Acceleration Boosts GPU Clocks Over and Over
content:
When watching some streams on Youtube on Firefox, my graphics card will boost to max clocks and down over and over, in turn heating up my gpu over and over and eventually reaching the point where my card heats up enough that the fans turn on. This causes my MSI Afterburner gpu temperature curve to look like a continually rising set of sharp shark teeth.

This issue seems to not affect all Youtube streams, but most of the ones I watch. It does not occur when hardware acceleration is turned off. On Chrome and Edge this issue is not present even when watching the same stream and with hardware acceleration turned on.

Watching streams on Youtube should not heat up a card this hard and boost clocks over and over for no good reason, and I hope the Firefox team can resolve this as quick as possible.
creator: aznsloverice

title: The connection has timed out
content:
Hi Support, I am now so frustrated with Firefox that I want to go back to Chrome.

I have been using Firefox for years and have not had major issues yet.

A couple of months ago my hard disc died and I had to reinstall Windows 10 and everything else. Since the reinstall I keep getting the The connection has timed out error every time I load Firefox and it sometimes take 10 to 15 minutes before I can surf the web.

I have Firefox installed on my Laptop and Work PC and don't have the issue with them, only this PC. All settings are synced and there are no differences between the Extensions etc. which are loaded.

On this PC I have Zone Alarm and the other two, Norton. What I have tried: 1. Changed proxy to auto-detect proxy settings for this network 2. Zone Alarm, checked that Firefox is allowed - removed the settings and it is now a Super Trusted and all functions allowed. 3. Disabled all Extensions - yes then it seems to work, but why does my Laptop and Work PC not have this problem with them enabled? 4. have tried a couple of other recommendations but I cannot remember what they were.

But still no success. Any Ideas?
creator: Murtu

title: Adding bookmark -> Choose Folder -> Cannot see folder names
content:
Hi, The attached image explains the problem in 3 steps. 1. I try to add a bookmark, a pop-up window appears. OK. 2. I get a menu with some recent bookmark folders, but I want a different one, so I press "Choose folder". OK. 3. Now I need to browse among numerous folders in my bookmarks, it worked fine before, but I cannot do it anymore because the folder names are not visible! As if they are written with a white font on a white background. I can scroll, choose (blindly) some folder, which is marked by the faint rectangle visible on the image. And the bookmark will be saved to that folder indeed. But scrolling blindly through my hundred folders is obviously not practical.

The problem appeared 1-2 weeks ago, probably after a FF update. Now I updated FF to the latest version 97.0.1, it doesn't help.

A couple of months ago I did some changes in FF config in particular to make bookmarks appear more dense: newer FF versions introduced huge vertical space between bookmarks. I can't remember what exactly I did (followed some recipe on internet), but it didn't introduce any problems. The problems appeared 1-2 weeks ago. System: Windows 10.
creator: dansh

title: Browser reduces YouTube volume wen rewinding
content:
A while ago I formatted my computer, and installed FireFox for the first time. Ever since installing FireFox, I noticed an issue which has been a constant source of frustration, when I rewind any YouTube video the playback volume changes to a lower value, until I rewind again.

I tried looking online, this is the closest match I've found, but there's no solution there

I tested this issue on different browsers (Edge, and IE), no problems there. I tried disabling extensions, no change. I tried resetting FireFox, no change. I made sure that Windows doesn't automatically adjust system volume. I tested this issue on different Video platforms, no problems there.

I use YouTube when I practice (music), so I rewind a lot.

Any help is very appreciated.
creator: yosi1.lints

title: Foutmelding Beveiligde verbinding mislukt
content: Na mijn overgang naar Firefox 96 blijk ik problemen te hebben met het benaderen van verschillende websites, waarbij DigiD-gebonden websites. Zodra ik een DigiD-gebonden website opvraag krijg ik de foutmelding "Beveiligde verbinding mislukt". Ik heb Firefox gedeïnstalleerd en weer geïnstalleerd; ik heb Firefox gedeïnstalleerd, alle Firefox-registervermeldingen ongedaan gemaakt, en Firefox weer geïnstalleerd; ik heb de oplossingspagina voor de foutmelding "Beveiligde verbinding mislukt" gevolgd, TLS 1.0 en 1.1 geactiveerd. Niets helpt. Ik gebruik Bitdefender als Internet Security. Omdat het allemaal wel werkt met de browsers Edge en Vivaldi, kom ik tot de conclusie dat het aan Firefox ligt. Echter, op mijn Macbook zit ook Firefox en Bitdefender; daarop werkt het allemaal wel: ik kan DigiD-gebonden websites zonder meer benaderen. En ook op een andere pc, waarop Firefox en Bitdefender zijn geïnstalleerd, werkt het allemaal. De conclusie zou dus moeten zijn, dat het aan mijn pc ligt. Ik gebruik Windows 10, geheel up to date. Graag suggesties hoe het kan worden opgelost.
creator: Rob.Hartman

title: I cannot access my bank's website in Firefoc
content:
Hello,

Is this problem only specific to this website or is it related to the latest updates by Firefox?

I've already tried disabling all my add-ons, extensions, and my internet security extension in Firefox, but to no avail. Note that I'm using Firefox 97.0.1 and my internet security suite is Kaspersky.

title: firefox blocks browser based zoom access to laptop speakers
content: When joining a Zoom meeting hosted on the browser rather than installed Zoom app, my speakers are not working and the troubleshooting error messages says the browser is blocking zoom from accessing the speakers. I can't find a setting in Firefox preferences to block/allow it. Speakers work on YouTube/Vimeo with no problems (speaker volume 100% and not muted). Speakers had been working with Zoom until a couple weeks ago. I don't want to install the Zoom app just because Google hates privacy and and I don't want to help them own my privacy anymore than I must. I use DuckDuckGo for the default search engine, have Ghostery for an Extension/add-on, and have the Firefox browser set for private window always. I have tried various cookie settings for the Zoom meetings and even the dreaded "accept all cookies" and have Firefox cookie handling set to Standard, with deleting all cookies and history upon exit. I am on 64-bit Windows 10 up to date as of 2/16/22, Dell computer updated to same date, and latest update of Firefox 2/18/22. I have done a number of web searches and not finding the speaker topic or error message other than three unanswered help requests from others with the same problem dated from July-Sept 2021.

title: Netflix broken once I log on to Firefox Sync?
content:
I have confirmed logging onto Firefox Sync does indeed break Netflix for me. I just was not so sure until now...

Details: I've gone a couple weeks without syncing and had no issues with any websites; watched lots of Netflix too.

After today's upgrade to FF97, I decided to risk it and log back onto Sync. Right away Netflix was broken in its tab, with "Pardon the Interruption. This title is not available to be watched instantly. Please try another title. -1044" and then "Error Code F7121 - 1331"

I have received this error code and more other similar ones from Netflix back a few weeks ago when I was actively troubleshooting this glitch. None of the fixes worked, and the ones that involved sifting through many dozens of about:config settings were avoided.

Thing is, back then, I made no changes I can surely recall, except upgrading to FF 96. OK, maybe some others...

And what's happening to my Netflix tab is not happening to any other tabs/sites, now or before; just Netflix.

I'm hoping someone here has seen this same thing happen and can shed some light on why my FF synced login breaks Netflix but when I'm not logged in, Netflix is ok.

Thanks;
creator: mkwritch
